meanings.definition: Containing larger, solid pieces or chunks.
meanings.sent1: The stew was chunkier than usual, with big pieces of vegetables in it.
meanings.sent2: The oatmeal became chunkier when more oats were added to it.
meanings.sent3: The sandwich was so chunkier than expected, it was hard to take a bite!
meanings.sent4: Her handwriting became chunkier as she wrote faster, like bold strokes on a canvas.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle pieces were chunkier than he remembered, making it easier to assemble.

meanings.definition: Having a thicker or more substantial appearance or texture.
meanings.sent1: The sweater felt chunkier after it was washed and dried.
meanings.sent2: The soup looked chunkier with the addition of more vegetables and meat.
meanings.sent3: The cat's tail looked chunkier than the rest of its body, giving it a funny appearance.
meanings.sent4: The clouds seemed chunkier today, casting darker shadows on the ground.
meanings.sent5: The tree trunk appeared chunkier as it aged, growing wider with each passing year.
